channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google and Apple Face Billions in Penalties After Losing E.U. Appeals
item.description: The cases had established the European Union as the world’s leading tech watchdog, but have since raised questions about its protracted appeals proces...

item.title: Australia Plans to Set Age Limits for Social Media
item.description: The government is considering setting a minimum age for platforms like TikTok and Instagram that could be as high as 16.

item.title: SpaceX launches daredevil billionaire into space to conduct first spacewalk by a private citizen
item.description: Entrepreneur Jared Isaacman and SpaceX shared the cost, which included developing and testing new spacesuits to see how they hold up in the harsh vacu...

item.title: Large Ukrainian Drone Attack Kills 1 Near Moscow, Russia Says
item.description: The Russian air defense system shot down 20 drones in the Moscow area and almost 150 nationwide, the country’s Defense Ministry said.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel Strikes Humanitarian Area; Gazan Authorities Say Dozens Are Killed
item.description: Israel’s military said it had targeted militants who carried out attacks. A Civil Defense official in Gaza said at least 40 people were killed.

item.title: Boeing union members angry over size of negotiated 25% raise may sink tentative contract deal
item.description: Leaflets distributed around Boeing’s Everett factory urged workers to reject “Boeing’s Bad Deal” and demanded the union fight for a 40% wage increase,...

item.title: Inside Trump-Harris Debate Prep, and Israel Strikes Humanitarian Zone
item.description: Plus, remembering an iconic Hollywood voice.

item.title: Large Ukrainian Drone Attack Kills 1 Near Moscow, Russia Says
item.description: The Russian air defense system shot down 20 drones in the Moscow area and almost 150 nationwide, the country’s Defense Ministry said.

item.title: U.K. may need to tax the wealthy or target inheritances to close £20 billion deficit left by previous government
item.description: Reeves hands are tied by Labour manifesto promises not to raise a number of big revenue-raising taxes, including income tax and VAT.

item.title: SpaceX’s Polaris Dawn Launch: What to Know About Planned Spacewalk
item.description: The mission is taking people farther from Earth than anyone has traveled since the end of NASA’s Apollo moon missions.

item.title: Boyfriend Who Set on Fire Olympic Runner Rebecca Cheptegei Dies
item.description: Dickson Ndiema died from injuries he sustained when he set Rebecca Cheptegei, his former partner, on fire. The police had planned to charge him with m...

item.title: Apple iPhone 16 gets game-changing camera button and AI-powered visual intelligence
item.description: The iPhone 16 “has been designed for Apple Intelligence from the ground up,” CEO Tim Cook said during Monday's event.

item.title: Fearing Airstrikes, Gaza School Shelters Try to Bar Hamas and Others
item.description: Residents, already forced to flee their homes by intense bombardment, want to avoid becoming a target for Israeli forces hunting Hamas.

item.title: Polio Vaccinations Begin in Northern Gaza After Israel Detained a UN Convoy
item.description: The U.N. said that Israeli forces held staff members for more than eight hours. The Israeli military said that it had intelligence suggesting there we...

item.title: The future is charging at us—and humanity must cope with what was once the stuff of science fiction
item.description: The costs of the shiny convenience that dangles from a convergence of AI, robotics, and the Internet of Things may be higher than we can readily fores...
